result.execSummary:
The defendant Sergio A Velasquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: 2nd/Sub. Drug Off.-Class E/F/G/H/I Fel.], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 33 days served if revoked.
***AMENDED JOC - TO REFLECT 961.48(1)(B) ENHANCER***

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge  kmk
kmk
kmk

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty David Saldana.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Repeater enhancer Sec. 939.62(1)(b) is dropped, on motion of the State.  Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 12 months w/conditions.  Credit for 33 days if probation is revoked.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty David Saldana.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Saldana requests time to dismiss case with ADA Delgado.  FPT 10/8/15 at 10:00.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Saldana.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Saldana needs to provide documentation to the State, anticipates the next hearing will be a plea.  FPT continued to 10/5/15 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.

With Atty Saldana, and by agreement of ADA Delgado the PTC of 8/26/15 at 8:15am is rescheduled to give deft time to locate the prescription he has for the drug he is charged with; reset to 9/16/15 at 8:30am, also the DA PTC of 8/21/15 at 1:30pm is cancelled.
Bail/Bond Signed

Defendant Sergio A Velasquez appeared with Attorney David Saldana.  Defendant in custody. Attorney K Richard Wells appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty plea entered. Arguments heard on DE's bond motion; ST does not object; The Court orders the bond modified to $500 signature with the same conditions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:15 am.
